comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Another shop wrecked by a mob (presumably as punishment for German ownership).

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Fert%C3%A9-sous-Jouarre Two quotes from the page: La Ferté-sous-Jouarre is a commune in the Seine-et-Marne département in the Île-de-France region in north-central France. La Ferté was occupied from the very beginning of [World War I] and its population was severely manhandled by the Germans.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: "Occupée dès le début de la guerre, La Ferté a vu sa population gravement molestée par les Allemands. La Ferté a été l'objet, en 1914 et en 1918, de violents bombardements qui ont détruit nombre de ses maisons. Malgré ses deuils, La Ferté a donné un bel exemple de sang-froid et d'endurance." Translation by Bing Translator: "La Ferté occupied at the beginning of the war, saw its population severely molested by the Germans. La Ferté was the object, in 1914 and in 1918, of violent bombardment which destroyed many of its houses. Despite its bereavements, La Ferté gave a good example of coolness and endurance." www.fotw.net/flags/fr-77-fj.html This shot may be from the battle aftermath, rather than mob violence. Another Bain Collection shot of the damaged town:
